info.name: Hackerthon Sandbox
info.description:
# ðŸš€ Get started here

This postman collection has been setup for the Hackerthon Stateful Sandbox. It is meant to closely match the live environments as possible.

The authorization requests are set to be optional for the hackerthon to foster quicker development, this feature can be enforced if its needed.

currently this Sandbox is setup to serve a single "profile" and each team will get their own environment.

Refer to the main [Investec API documentation](https://developer.investec.com/za/home) for more details.

If you have an API-related question, you can also discuss in the developer [community slack](https://i.imgur.com/aejg9QK.png).

### Auth

**Authentication** - Authentication example, can be skipped with this current config.

### Accounts

**Get Accounts** - Fetches a list of available accounts in the profile.

**Get Account Balance** - Fetches an accounts balance.

**Get Account transactions** - Fetch a list of an accounts transactions.

**Transfer Multiple** - Make inter-account transfers.

### Beneficiaries

**Beneficiaries** - List associated beneficiaries .

**Beneficiary Payment** - Make a payment to a beneficiary.

### Admin Control

These helper functions do not exist in the api and have been created to manage the sandbox.

**Create Account** - Create a new account under the current profile.

**Create Beneficiary** - Create a new beneficiary for external payments.

**Create Transactions** - This allows the injection of transactions with any date and amount.

**Delete Transactions** - Allows you to remove transactions based on a postingDate

request.description:
Investec Programmable Banking uses a modified version of the OAuth 2.0 standard by requiring an additional API Key to be added to authentication requests.

Currently the token from the Authentication Request needs to be copied into the environmental variables under token.

Tokens are valid for 30 mins.

query.description: Refers to the date range filter's start date. Will default to today's date, minus 180 days, if not specified. postingDate is used.
Refers to the date range filter's end date. Will default to today's date if not specified. postingDate is used for filtering.
Refers to the transaction type filter's value.

request.description:
Obtain a specified account's transactions.

Filtering is done using the postingDate

postingDate is the date at which the transaction affects your balance.

transactionDate is the date at which the transaction took place. The day the card was physically swiped.

Card transactions that are currently pending will not show in the transaction list.

There is no limits on the returned results

response.name: Get Account Transactions

Refers to the transaction type filter's value.

variable.description: Your bank account id where the funds will transfer from

request.description: Obtain a list of accounts in associated profile.

response.name: 200 OK

variable.description: Your bank account id where the funds will transfer from
Your bank account id where the funds will transfer from

item.description:
The Account Information API allows Investec SA Private Banking clients to access their account and transactional information (read-only) via an API.

It can be used to retrieve account information such as:

- Account details
- Balances
- Account transactions

There are many possible use cases for the Account Information API: from extracting the data to aggregate it with financial data from other banking institutions to personal money management tools.

item.name: Beneficiaries

request.description:
List of beneficiaries linked to the profile

Payment notifications will go out to beneficiaries emailAddress and cellNo fields. If these are null no notification will be sent out to that notification channel.

variable.description: (Required) Your bank account id where the funds will transfer from

request.description:
Make a payment to a beneficiary.

Beneficiaries need to be created online and a payment made via online before payments can be made via the API.

Beneficiary payments are limited to R20 000.

item.description:
Beneficiaries are third parties that can receive payment from your account. These could be the municipality, your internet service provider or any entity you would like to pay regularly.

The Beneficiaries api allows you to get a list of your available beneficiaries, view the beneficiaries categories and make payments to those beneficiaries.

Beneficiaries will need to be created via the online banking portal before they will reflect in the list.

For additional security you will only be able to pay a beneficiary via the api after a payment has been made via online banking.

request.description:
Obtain a specified account's transactions.

Filtering is done using the postingDate

postingDate is the date at which the transaction affects your balance.

transactionDate is the date at which the transaction took place. The day the card was physically swiped.

Card transactions that are currently pending will not show in the transaction list.

There is no limits on the returned results

Refers to the transaction type filter's value.
